content: Hey everyone, we are looking for french contributors to rust-lang or rust-core who would like to give a talk for LoOps, the french science software developers group in higher education (https://reseau-loops.github.io/index.html) ! Thank you for your consideration :)
@Léo Lanteri Thauvin @GuillaumeGomez @Poliorcetics

Thanks for the ping @Joshua Nelson !

@Chris de Claverie What talk? Will it be a virtual one or a physical one? When? About what? (Lot of questions hehe)
Sadly my life has been quite eventful recently and I haven’t had time to contribute to any open source :frown: much less rust itself
But to add more questions: what is the expected audience (level of knowledge, not numbers) ? Is it part of a group of talks or just a single one ?

Virtual or physical ? -> Depending on Covid, but hopefully physical
When ? -> September / October
About what ? -> Your choice, but about Rust, see below
Expected audience ? -> 20-50 people, science developers (mainly C/C++/python/Julia) in higher education. Mid-point between scientists and developers
Context ? -> A recurring event of one talk per month, of about 45 minutes

The objective would be of course to spread the word about Rust but also show how useful it could be in the field of science (concurrency / performance / memory safety / zero-cost abstractions / ...) and you could delve for example into some advanced performance or usability or static analysis subject just as you like and get their feedback and have Q/A session and probably even find contributors
I'm interested :smile: (I even still have some introductory/context-providing slides around)
oh, I didn't know DHM and poliorcetics were french :)
French people are well represented around here. ;)
Well anyway, seems like we have a voluntary so I guess we're all good. :)

GuillaumeGomez said:

French people are well represented around here. :wink:

image.png
